_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The employees of Nutrien Ag Solutions, West Isle Production ("The Facility" or "The Site"), located at

3201 Avenue 54, Alpaugh, California, are committed to the prevention of a release of hazardous chemicals

stored and handled at the facility. Specifically, Anhydrous Ammonia is stored in quantities exceeding the

threshold quantities listed in the EPA RMP standards. West Isle Production has developed a management

system for the RMP program, performed a Process Hazard Analysis, developed prevention program

elements and formulated an emergency response plan. If an accidental release should occur, the facility

will work with the local fire department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the

impact of the release to people and the environment. The emergency response plan has been developed

and would be implemented in the event of a release.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

The following activities occur at the facility:

a. The production of Ammonium Polyphosphate (NAICS Code 325311 - Nitrogenous Fertilizer

Manufacturing).

b. Receiving and storage of Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS Number 7664-41-7). Anhydrous Ammonia is

received by bulk tanker truck and stored in two 30,000-gallon capacity aboveground storage tanks.



Accidental Release Prevention Program

West Isle Production has comprehensive written programs and procedures to comply with the EPA Risk

Management Program (RMP) and California Accidental Release Program (CalARP) regulations. Facility

Management and Employees involved in the covered process are trained and aware of their responsibilities

to implement the RMP/CalARP Program requirements.



Five-Year Accident History

In the past 5 years, there have been no incidents involving the release of Anhydrous Ammonia resulting in

deaths, injuries or property damage at the facility. During the same period, there have been no incid

ents

involving the release of Anhydrous Ammonia resulting in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, property

damage or environmental damage.



The Emergency Response Program

The facility has incorporated provisions of the following regulations in their emergency plan:

? OSHA29 CFR 1910.38

? OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120

? Section 25503, Division 6



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety is an ongoing process at this facility. Inspections and audits are conducted periodically to assure

compliance with regulatory and company requirements.
